title: Grade 3
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

B34E9C87AFFA40FF87907DA594C3C098.description:
Sort information on a topic or personal experience into two provided
categories and write about each one (EE.W.3.8).

CB07A6B54CDD4748819C8CE0CD76A706.description: Present a brief report of research findings to an audience.

5B13F9210CD6479FB74A7470E1D03291.description:
Develop supporting visual information (e.g., charts, maps, illustrations,
models).

11865F58D50B4E3FBA2E1DE3CE014DF1.description:
Interpret and communicate the information learned by developing a
summary statement and at least one detail.

D5DC42732D804ECEB552798A4DABA3F1.description: Identify information about a topic for a research project (EE.W.3.7).

34823BC66CF046EB977B7EF4565A4923.description: With guidance and support students can:

A3F4C35AC235472FBD0F73B4278C59A3.description: Gather, interpret, and communicate information discovered during short research projects.

8CF496207F67483D938DB29A6A5EB6D1.description: Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences (EE.W.10).

12381CF8C9854BF5AFB653251FB83868.description:
Use technology to produce writing while interacting and collaborating with
others (EE.W.6).

7050D16E9F6140F0A90F6A2C93AD9766.description: Produce writing that expresses more than one idea (EE.W.3.4).

8DABA10D68A842138C35B6E559A12BCC.description:
Use language to make simple requests, comment, or share information
(EE.L.3.3a).

B20304AC918E42688567216FFFF5E435.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating (EE.L.3.3).

481308E3879645F69E6BCF81D1D71B6E.description:
Consult print in the environment to support reading and spelling
(EE.L.3.2g).

6CA7F54567D04E048457535D0F5FFEC3.description:
Use spelling patterns in familiar words with common spelling patterns to
spell words with the same spelling patterns (EE.L.3.2f).

4F43914411D645FA966466E401A5E4E2.description:
Use resources as needed to spell common high-frequency words
accurately (EE.L.3.2e).Â

EF0AA82419454E5F8F27F30DF2AF5946.description:
During shared writing, indicate the need to add a period at the end of a
sentence (EE.L.3.2b).

A4894CE9F6464555AC125DC541FC65F1.description: Capitalize the first letter of familiar names (EE.L.3.2a).

2C75AF0F9FCF415085A34816058202ED.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English (EE.L.3.2).

7994BC02F1334B0EA1A58C2E5C6BD810.description: Use present and past tense verbs (EE.L.3.1d).

6EADF6F5BA074851B210CF6CFA9D99F0.description: Use regular plural nouns in communication (EE.L.3.1b).Â

BF7D170936B74B99839BD9D9E066B1E3.description:
Use noun + verb, noun + adjective, and subject + verb + object
combinations in communication (EE.L.3.1a).

EB616E1DA29048BA9DC5C2EF78C93DA3.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage when communicating
(EE.L.3.1).

8488061A7DFB4BB0BE8CB66C864BA834.description: With guidance and support students can:

140835FC8BAF4DF4AE396A5E3DD7EFEE.description:
Use a recursive process to plan, draft, revise, and edit writing, applying knowledge of the conventions of grammar, capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling.

7C80204110904F8C8F937412CC83FA51.description: Provide a concluding statement or sentence in a narrative.

534BA52A987348C092EEC323AD8FDC8B.description:
Use transitional words (e.g., first, next, then) when writing about a series of
events.

3EEB36B7969E4B26917146F50E094AE9.description:
Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts and feelings to develop a
story.

A6690AEE5F0348CA9AFADDF9209FA9E6.description:
Select an event or personal experience and write about it including the
names of people involved.

9DF91FEAFA7143E19AC8FE45AFF5CB25.description: Write about events or personal experiences (EE.W.3.3).

BB4D16B8DCE8415495FC66FD1C1A7C14.description: With guidance and support students can:

4D704815B699468681C827E83CDDB0F8.description: Write real or imagined narratives that use descriptive details, have a clear sequence of events, and provide closure.

5E62E43388F6404196275A7DC4301D7A.description:
Provide a concluding statement or sentence for an
informational/explanatory text.

FB986173329E41F1B2F49ADB165C17FB.description:
Use a linking word or phrase (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect
ideas.

174016BAB56347198E0620EDA86FCC92.description:
Compose a topic sentence and generate one factual sentence about the
topic.

82C098D41AA04F6AA2844F1805D0BB31.description: Select a topic and write about it including one fact or detail (EE.W.3.2a).

42F2E43BABC943BFBA1257EE013174F5.description: Write to share information supported by details (EE.W.3.2).

7267A3B0E3F44C6186734FF4E54A018E.description: With guidance and support students can:

2D9FBEED63894A8396D425B98F3F6EA8.description: Write informative/explanatory texts developed with facts, definitions, and details, ending with a related concluding statement.

F73E96C117204742B48CBF22301C8238.description: Provide a concluding statement to summarize the information presented.

09DBD02CC9234AB5BC68C3E5EBA6F493.description:
Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example)
to connect opinion and reasons.Â

6AFC6A6E7CEB4F85902452674B8194C3.description: Write one reason to support an opinion about a text (EE.W.3.1b).Â

D73BAD4666DA4B99A0DF022B155A8A96.description: Select text and write an opinion about it (EE.W.3.1a).

7015D3E15FC241DF94141C645814671B.description: Write opinions about topics or text (EE.W.3.1).

1B488D88E31F433EB26D203772E9E98A.description: With guidance and support students can:

5D791F8EE11A49AA948B602E9BA1B1C9.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

142CF0AF520647D9B51332F9E7DE3C29.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words that signal spatial and temporal
relationships (e.g., behind, under, after, soon, next, later) (EE.L.3.6).

52E52945190440DBB9BA778E2CDC512A.description: Identify words that describe personal emotional states (EE.L.3.5c).

BAC903FB08094717A7DD5A946BE2C6BA.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., happy:
âI am happy.â) (EE.L.3.b5).

E86555E4E6B14040BB6A10A0650721CD.description:
Determine the literal meaning of words and phrases in context
(EE.L.3.5a).

0AEF868F784D4B0F9971DE8AA46348DD.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use (EE.L.3.5).

739D408B28864F20B37D2A4B59F35988.description:
Use a variety of general and domain specific vocabulary (adapted from
L.3.4d).

C3F8303992BB43A6AB7D707259CF2B71.description:
Identify the temporal meaning of words when common affixes (-ing, -
ed) are added to common verbs (EE.L.3.4b).

99FBF25ABC984074BBA0D010C8740D84.description:
Use sentence level context to determine what word is missing from a
sentence read aloud (EE.L.3.4a).

227E3BD41DA64C4DA38F7580B4088541.description: Use context to determine missing words in familiar texts (EE.RF.3.4c).

F3DEFCAE80364702B2145BD6257470ED.description: Read familiar text comprised of known words (EE.RF.3.4a).

8EA1F6CA74374F4A809A9CB6E9F85E26.description:
With models and supports, decode single-syllable words with common
spelling patterns (consonant-vowel-consonant [CVC] or high-frequency
rimes) (EE.RF.3.3b).

31CC6C83B76E4ECFBB9A8DBD4BA750A3.description:
In context, demonstrate basic knowledge of letter-sound
correspondences (EE.RF.3.3a).

5015AB7DBF09447CB842EE859B6165D1.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words (EE.RF.3.3).

50BE5B9AFA014904859B8202E98F26A3.description: With guidance and support students can:

2870C2343719485285E9964799AEC6E7.description:
Apply knowledge of spelling patterns (orthography), word meanings (morphology), and word relationships to decode words and increase
vocabulary.

7B359989E340443AA3BAE07C2C9977D9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while actively engaged in shared
reading or history/social studies, science, and technical texts (EE.RI.3.10).

BF22087ADA5347C2A2C2909CCB368395.description: Identify similarities between two texts on the same topic (EE.RI.3.9).

D63B126534FA4B00BC61EF82192BF42E.description:
Identify two related points the author makes in an informational text
(EE.RI.3.8).

CE253BA60F6F46A3B483447EC46F7A5E.description:
Use information gained from visual elements and words in the text to
answer explicit who and what questions (EE.RI.3.7).

030F737C4D4346F4AF7AC75089277A99.description: Identify personal point of view about a text (EE.RI.3.6).

5DA4148A5B014848AC97F6A9CBAAC925.description:
Use text features including headings and key words to locate
information in a text (EE.RI.3.5).

B9378B83EB2D4C3084AB229D523378AF.description:
Determine words and phrases that complete literal sentences in a text
(EE.RI.3.4).

2C10254A402F45A78CFEB8A4EFFD25E8.description: Order two events from a text as âfirstâ and ânextâ (EE.RI.3.3).

E8767E2357824E28B902DC757DE89F02.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate understanding of details in
a text (EE.RI.3.1).

2729F8F7F20F470394CB7A51F5FC6DC9.description: With guidance and support students can:

B6317CF0E2C64478959962B70C3152E2.description: Apply strategies to fluently read and comprehend various informational texts.

A41A2959676546D0B725CCFB17EDE61F.description: Read grade level or adapted text with accuracy.

717670DEA6D24E4087AC908DEDD946F9.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively engaged in shared reading of
stories, dramas, and poetry (EE.RL.3.10).Â

B6C98E65A10E483EAE5F590C76347223.description: Identify common elements in two stories in a series (EE.RL.3.9)

672461406F884758A0D16B468BD80C71.description:
Identify parts of illustrations or tactual information that depict a particular
setting, or event (EE.RL.3.7).

8157442087D34D469A8048484523304D.description: Identify personal point of view about a text (EE.RL.3.6).

BB7C3386D8844BD988CBC47D5AD063E4.description:
Determine the beginning, middle, and end of a familiar story with a
logical order (EE.RL.3.5).

080961071A5D415F8FC33A417D5C7F7B.description:
Determine words and phrases that complete literal sentences in a text
(EE.RL.3.4).

120A9B98BE304F22A3E775F8926589C1.description: Identify the feelings of characters in a story (EE.RL.3.3).

D8A3F5F43184414F90A3B46C9F935C86.description: Associate details with events in stories from diverse cultures (EE.RL.3.2).

F0E68051A0494E4F9AADD508DE986F06.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate understanding of details in
a text (EE.RL.3.1).

F6FC5C88812C4FD7AF61D581B7B0A3A5.description: With guidance and support students can:

069B814AE2784436860620511D24CECC.description: Apply strategies to fluently read and comprehend various literary texts.

541146F0CEE049D5A7A428ED8A67BC9D.description:
Communicate complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation
using a variety of communication modalities.

33C8EB2059C04C8390468C590EBF2625.description:
Create presentations of stories or poems using a variety of communication
modalities.

C8BD82AB787642B39CE042880AB307AB.description:
Organize information about a personal experience or specific event in
sequential order.

0E52EEA306EA409EA735C7E3383BB353.description:
Express ideas clearly using appropriate volume, pitch, symbols, pictures, or
other communication modalities to match the purpose and audience.

82647C3E085F4B5BB2BE960A26E09465.description:
Communicate a message using contextual language in informal and formal
situations.

0C4B0107B5E4473986D80B09CA37B262.description: Recount a personal experience, story, or topic including details (EE.SL.3.4).

3BB5B730D7824A8FB1A0C6D7A35D115B.description: With guidance and support students can:

88DC47587E974DB484F3CBC3E9A2E621.description: Communicate using appropriate language in informal and formal situations.

82321B8BB8D444E780590E9B056AC0D5.description:
Ask or answer questions about the details provided by the speaker
(EE.SL.3.3).

B70FCBEF56284662884F53B6F022EE0B.description:
Identify details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or
through other media (EE.SL.3.2).

F8ADB5C6BB8A4034AA47330A705CD20D.description:
Indicate confusion or lack of understanding about information
presented (EE.SL.3.1c).

37BB9D6A0CB649388A32B78EFC70F053.description: Listen to othersâ ideas before responding (EE.SL.3.1b).

ECAC9A88158C458A960A0C0933B99B10.description: Engage in collaborative interactions about texts (EE.SL.3.1a).
